entry.title: Mid-Market SaaS Companies: Running SaaS with Cloud Agility vs. Duct-Tape Systems – Best Practice
entry.content:
Are you a rapidly growing SaaS company looking to streamline your operations and scale efficiently?  

Many believe that SAP is only for large enterprises, focused solely on financials, and prohibitively expensive. Let's dispel those myths! 

Introducing SAP Business Suite for Software Providers SAP Business Suite is designed to support the varied lines of businesses within a SaaS company.  

Whether you are: 

  • A CFO  who needs to manage cash flow, budgets, close the books quickly, and provide real-time business visibility to drive strategic decisions. 
  • A CRO looking to manage your sales pipeline, offer flexible monetization models, and expand into new markets while scaling growth. 
  • A CHRO aiming to manage talent effectively, secure the right skills, and foster ongoing talent development. 
  • A COO striving to automate processes, scale efficiently, and integrate siloed departments. 

SAP Business Suite addresses these and more with its innovative business platform. 

Hear from Software Providers Leveraging SAP Cloud ERP: 

  • Leadsquared has automated subscription services with SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition. 
  • Seralla harmonized data to support robust lead-to-cash and hire-to-retire processes after a swift migration to the Public Cloud. 

Exciting News: New Industry Best Practice for Subscription Management for Software 

We are thrilled to announce the launch of our Industry Best Practice for Subscription Management for Software. We understand the unique challenges you face: 

  • Data Complexity: Digital offerings require flexible setup, unlike physical products. 
  • Sales System Limitations: Evolving go-to-market strategies demand agile packaging and pricing solutions. 
  • Manual Subscription Processes between sales and provisioning: Decoupled processes lead to errors, customer dissatisfaction, and compliance risks. 
  • Revenue Recognition: Non-integrated processes and manual tasks pose compliance threats. 
  • Subscription Changes: Managing changes during the subscription lifecycle can be cumbersome. 

SAP Business Suite for Software Providers addresses these issues with integrated capabilities, allowing you to streamline your operations and accelerate growth.  

The latest SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition 2508 includes a predefined SAP Best Practice to speed up your adoption. 

And if you are a service or product-centric company that also sells digital assets – you can utilize this SAP Best Practice as well. 

Interested in Learning More? 

  • For Prospects: Enabling sustainable growth for Software Providers 
  • For Existing SAP Customers:  Scope item details on SAP for Me – SAP Signavio Process Explorer 
  • For Partners and SAP Experts: 
  • Webinar 1: Scope Item 5SW: Subscription Management for Software – Part 1 
  • Webinar 2: Scope Item 5SW: Subscription Management for Software – Part 2 
  • For Scaleups – high-growth companies experiencing rapid expansion, growing 20% or more in employee headcount and turnover over the last three years. - Grow with SAP for Scaleups 

 

Take the Next Step Towards Agility and Growth 

SAP Business Suite for Software Providers empowers you to optimize your operations, adapt quickly to market changes, and deliver exceptional customer experiences. Join the C-suite leaders who are embracing SAP's cutting-edge solutions to drive their businesses forward. 

Let's connect and discuss how SAP can transform your SaaS journey!

entry.title: 资产会计 - 历史过账数据迁移 - 在会计年度末传输 - SAP ERP 公有云
entry.content:
自动传输通过 SAP-S/4HANA 迁移主控室进行数据转移，要创建新的历史数据传输细分，请在"对公司代码进行设置 - 资产会计特定"应用中执行以下步骤：

  1. 打开"对公司代码进行设置 - 资产会计特定"应用。
  2. 选择用户计划迁移历史数据的公司代码。
  3. 点击"编辑"按钮。
  4. 在"历史数据转移设置"标签页中点击"创建"按钮。
  5. 指定所需参数或确认默认值：
    ○ 输入转移日期：31.12.XXXX
    ○ 转移状态：正在进行（允许其他过账）
    ○ 凭证类型：资产过账（AA）（根据用户的业务需求选择）
    ○ 如果必要，设置指示器以抑制折旧计算。
    ○ 如有必要，输入注释。
  6. 点击"保存"。

 

迁移数据 - 迁移主控室应用

在打开"固定资产 - 过账模板"后，用户必须填写过账代码表。然后，根据用户的业务需求填写累计值表。

通常导致错误的关键考虑事项包括：

  1. 当前财年：这应该反映当前公司代码设置的最高财年。
  2. 分账特定行项目类型：展开第八行以查看并验证分账的特定行项目类型。

 

客户通常希望转移诸如资产价值和累计折旧的数据。
• 当前财年：2025年
• 历史数据转移日期：2024年12月31日

以下是供参考的示例：

  • • 资产编号：12345678
  • 资产购置价值：1000 CNY
  • 累计折旧价值：-200 CNY

还有许多其他分账特定的行项目类型可供选择。用户可以根据实际业务需求进行选择和填写。

entry.title: Extensibility Assistant for Key Users: The extensibility expert right next to you
entry.content:
Extensibility Assistant for Key Users: The extensibility expert right next to you

Have you ever been in a situation

  • where you had to create or maintain a key user custom field or create some key user custom logic but wondered which business context, which OData service, which SOAP service, or in general which object you must extend out of the thousands of potential candidates?
  • or where you must figure out which CDS view you should choose as value help provider for your key user custom field out of the thousands of options?
  • or where you know the UI or API service to which you need to add an extension field, but you have no idea which business context or data source needs to be extended?

If your answer is yes, then this blog post is just for you. In this blog, you’ll meet the GenAI-driven Extensibility Assistant, which helps you to master such challenges. Starting with the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release, the extensibility assistant is available in the Custom Fields Fiori app and in the Custom Logic Fiori app.

You’ll learn how to make the extensibility assistant available in your system and for your user and how to use it.

How to make the extensibility assistant available in your system and for your user

The extensibility assistant belongs to the feature set of Joule for Developers (J4D) for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. The first step you need to take to make the extensibility assistant available in a system is to “activate” J4D for the system. How this can be done is described in SAP Note 3571857. You can find more information regarding J4D in general (also regarding the licensing) here: https://www.sap.com/documents/2025/02/b4f714de-f57e-0010-bca6-c68f7e60039b.html

Please note that the GenAI-driven extensibility assistant is only available for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and only in systems where development is supported:

  • In 3-system landscapes, this is the development system

Once J4D is activated for your system, you need to assign the business catalog SAP_A4C_BC_DEV_AIQ_PC to your user. Please note that you need to use client 100, as the key user extensibility apps are only available there.

You can assign the business catalog in various ways:

  1. copy the extensibility template business role SAP_BR_EXTENSIBILITY_SPEC to your own role and assign this copied role to your user. You can refer to Maintain Business Roles for further details on how to maintain business roles
  2. assign the business catalog SAP_A4C_BC_DEV_AIQ_PC to another custom business role that you assign to your user

As soon as the business catalog SAP_A4C_BC_DEV_AIQ_PC is assigned to your user, the button “Open Assistant” will be active in the Custom Logic and the Custom Fields Fiori app (see screenshots below).

Open Assistant button in Custom Fields and Custom Logic Fiori app

If it turns out that though you followed all the steps described above  still the "Open Assistant" button does not occur please create a customer ticket on application component BC-SRV-APS-EXT-FLD.

How to use the extensibility assistant in the Custom Fields Fiori app.

When you click “Open Assistant” in the Custom Fields Fiori app, the extensibility assistant pops up (see screenshot below):

Initial screen of the extensibility assistant in the Custom Fields Fiori app

You can now enter your question or your request in the text box located under the “Your Question” label.

You’ll notice a question mark icon next to the “Your Question” label. Clicking the question mark, a popup appears explaining you how to interact with the extensibility assistant, providing you recommendations when it comes to how to formulate your questions, and showing you a set of example questions (see screenshot below):

Explanation popup of the extensibility assistant in the Custom Fields Fiori app

To understand in detail how to interact with the extensibility assistant, let’s have a look at a concrete example. Let’s assume that you were told to create a custom field which should capture an UPS tracking number of parcels belonging to specific sales orders. The field should be included in the OData API for Customer Return documents, as this information is essential for communication with another company.
In general, let’s say that you know the Custom Fields Fiori app, and you know how to create a custom field (by pressing the + button on the upper left corner of the Custom Fields app).
What you’ll most likely not know is which business context you have to choose out of the more than 500 available ones. You most likely also won’t know the exact name of the OData API in which you should enable the field.

That is where the extensibility assistant comes in handy. The scenario mentioned above usually consists of the following steps:

1. You enter your question or your request into the question text box. In this case, the text we enter is “Create a field UPSTrackingNumber and enable it for the customer return OData API”. As soon as you’ve entered the text and pressed the return button (or clicked on the arrow button on the right), the assistant’s answer is shown in the “Assistant Response” text box. It might be for example “I found multiple business contexts related to "customer return". Please choose one of the following options:”. Please note that on the lower right corner of the “Assistant Response” text box, there is a link to “References”. Opening the link, you’ll get a list of SAP documentation links like Fiori Apps Library links, Business Accelerator Hub links, and others which have been the knowledge source of the assistant’s answer. You can click on these links to navigate to these documents. Within the “Assistant Proposal” box, there are business contexts shown which are relevant to the context of your question. You can simply choose one of them by pressing the select button on the right side of the respective option (see screenshot below).

Select business context

In our case, the UPSTrackingNumber field belongs to the header of the Sales Order document. We’ll choose the business context SD_SALESDOC with the description “Sales: Sales Document”.
Note that the extensibility assistant shows a relevance score telling you how relevant the finding is in the context of your question.

2.As soon as you’ve selected the respective business context, the extensibility assistant responds for example “I found multiple OData APIs related to customer return. Please choose one of the following options to enable the custom field:”. You’ll see a list of OData API options from which you can choose. Please note that in this case, a column “Documentation” is shown which allows you to navigate directly to the documentation of the respective OData API to validate whether this is really the API you were looking for (see screenshot below).

Select OData API
In this case, you select the second-best option, as you prefer to use an OData V2 service and not its OData V4 variant.

3. As soon as you’ve selected the OData API option, the extensibility assistant responds for example “The custom field UPSTrackingNumber has been prepared for enabling in the OData API Customer Return (A2X) - V2 (API_CUSTOMER_RETURN_SRV~1). Please make sure to save the changes to make them permanent. If you need any further assistance, feel free to ask!” and proposes an action which you can see in the “Proposed Action” box on the bottom of the extensibility assistant pop-up (see screenshot below).

Proposed Create custom field action

You can now check whether the proposal of the assistant fits your needs and if so, you can simply click “Accept” on the lower right side of the “Proposed Action” box. With that, the data is handed over to the “Create Field” screen of the Custom Fields app (see screenshot below).

Proposal taken over from the extensibility assistant to the “New Field” popup

You can check the data once again and change it if needed. There is always a human in-between, and the extensibility assistant never does something on its own within the system.

Please note that instead of clicking “Accept”, you can continue to chat with the extensibility assistant as it remembers the conversation history. You can, for example, ask the extensibility assistant “Why did you choose a length of 50 for this field” and in the “Assistant Response” the assistant will answer for example “The length of 50 for the custom field UPSTrackingNumber was chosen as a reasonable default to accommodate typical tracking numbers, which can vary in length depending on the carrier and format. If you have specific requirements or need a different length, please let me know, and I can adjust it accordingly!”.
You can also ask the assistant to enable the field in further usages like APIs or SOAP services, or any other available location.

Now, we’ve used the extensibility assistant to master our UPSTrackingNumber challenge, where the assistant helped us to identify the correct business context and propagate the field to the OData API where we needed it to be.
The extensibility assistant supports the following scope:

  • Create Custom Fields: It can create new custom fields in various business contexts.
  • Find Business Contexts: It can help you find the right business context to extend for your custom fields.
  • Find Usages: It can identify where custom fields can be used, such as in UIs, APIs, CDS views, transactions, etc.
  • Enable Usages: It can enable custom fields in identified usages (note that email or form templates are not supported).
  • Find Business Scenarios: It can find business scenarios that involve data flow between different business objects.
  • Find Existing Custom Fields: It can locate existing custom fields in specific business contexts.
  • Find Value Helps: It can find value helps that can be used in custom fields.

How to use the extensibility assistant in the Custom Logic Fiori app

Just like in the Custom Fields Fiori app, you can click “Open Assistant” in the Custom Logic Fiori app, which opens the extensibility assistant (see screenshot below):

Initial screen of the extensibility assistant in the Custom Logic Fiori app

You can now enter your query to find an extension point in the text box located under the “Your Question” label. As this assistant helps with finding extension points, it’s recommended to enter a query where you outline what you want your implementation to do. As soon as you have formulated your query, you can press enter or click the send button. After a short wait, you are prompted with extension points that fit your query.

Currently, the assistant doesn’t support code generation but can only be used to find the correct extension point for your use case. If you are unsure of what the assistant can do, you can ask “What can you do?” to get an answer. In the following section, you find an example on when and how to use the extensibility assistant in the Custom Logic Fiori app.

Imagine you get a new requirement for your bill of materials that you need to implement. If your new requirement is not met, the bill of materials should not be saved. To find the extension point that lets you insert custom checks, you tell the assistant “I want to validate my BOM before it is saved”. Once entered, the assistant prompts you with multiple extension points that might fit your use case (as you can see in the screenshot below):

Extensibility assistant after entering a query

List of references that contain further information and documentation

To choose the right extension point, you can have a look at the extension point’s documentation or further documents about the shown extension points. You can find that information by clicking the “References” link under the assistant’s response. There, you’ll find a list of links that will open the resource in your browser. If you click on the extension point’s documentation, a popup will open containing said documentation. Additionally, you will find the extension point’s documentation by clicking the link “View Documentation” in the table.

Popup with the extension point’s documentation

Once you’ve chosen the right extension point, you can select it from the list and click on “Create Implementation”. This will direct you to the creation wizard (see screenshot below). There, the extension point will already be selected for you. From there, you can create the implementation just like you would normally. If you can’t create an implementation for the selected extension point because it can only be implemented once, you get a warning that tells you which implementation already exists for the selected extension point.

Extension point table after selection

Warning if the extension point is already implemented

Now, we’ve successfully used the extensibility assistant in the Custom Logic Fiori app. The extensibility assistant in this app supports the following scope:

  • Find BAdIs: I can find the right BAdI for your custom implementation.

It currently does not support code generation.

Please note that the extensibility assistant is only available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition so far. The intention is to also make it available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, but we can’t share any timeline regarding that yet.

Now, you are done! Congratulations!
You successfully used the extensibility assistant to master challenges with key user custom fields and key user custom logic. You have an idea about the scope of the assistant so that you know what it can do for you, and you know what comes next.

Please note that this blog has been elaborated by a team of experts. I want to thank Yasmina van Rooij (YasminavanRooij), Mathis Neunzig (Mathis Neunzig), Christian Holzer (ChristianHolzer), Yannick Schmitt ( yannickschmitt ) , and Karsten Schaser (Karsten_Schaser) for their extremely helpful contributions.

entry.title: 智领未来：SAP S/4HANA Cloud 公有云中的 AI 架构与构建模块解析
entry.content:
在日常工作中，客户和合作伙伴经常会问到SAP S/4HANA Cloud 公有云到底有哪些 AI 功能？

之前也通过文章分别介绍了 SAP Joule、嵌入式 AI、情境处理（Situation Handling）等具体功能。而今天这篇博客，我想从另一个角度聊聊——也就是 ​​SAP S/4HANA Cloud 公有云中的 AI 架构​​，以及构建起众多 AI 功能的​​核心模块​​，希望能帮助大家更系统地理解这些 AI 能力，以及 SAP 在 AI 功能开发上的重点方向。

SAP S/4HANA Cloud 公有云版将 AI 深度嵌入核心业务流程中，通过一系列精心设计的 AI 构建模块，将“AI 视作新的用户界面”（AI is the new UI），致力于为用户带来更直观、高效和智能的工作体验。这些功能不仅简化日常操作、自动化复杂任务，还提供前瞻性的智能洞察，成为智慧企业的重要基石。

从应用层面上来看，我们把这些模块归纳的功能分为几大类：

  • 面向用户体验的 AI​​：内置搜索文本生成什么代码生成等增强用户体验的功能。
  • 面向互动的 AI​​：以 Joule 为入口的对话式 AI，查询处理数据等。
  • 面向自动化的 AI​​：系统可自动完成任务，诸如文档处理，AI agent等自主任务完成。
  • 面向洞察和决策的 AI​​：借助机器学习、情框管理引擎，生成式AI能力，预测预估需求、判断延迟付款或识别潜在风险，并为用户提供下一步最佳措施与智能建议，辅助制定更明智的决策。

下面，我会为您带来每一个模块的详细解析：

S/4HANA Public Cloud中的AI构建模块

 

1： User Experience 用户体验 （内嵌式 AI辅助功能)：优化系统交互，实现“AI 即新 UI”的愿景

这些 AI 能力直接嵌入在云 ERP 系统中，它们通过自然语言处理 (NLP)生成摘要和提供筛选等功能，使搜索和处理业务数据更加高效。

核心功能与技术：

  • 智能摘要 (Smart Summarization)：对基于 Fiori Elements 的业务对象进行智能摘要，涵盖 1000 多个应用程序。
  • 简易筛选 (Easy Filter)：允许用户通过自然语言描述所需数据来筛选列表报告，适用于超过 1100 份报告。
  • 企业搜索 (Enterprise Search)：支持用户使用自然语言进行企业搜索。

许可：这些功能均属于免费的基础 AI (Base AI)，无需购买AI Unit，并且在客户接受 SAP AI 条款后，由 SAP 激活：

2： Joule：SAP专属智能副驾： 快速获取信息，简化应用程序导航，直接管理业务数据

Joule 通过直观的对话方式来简化协作用户日常工作。作为云ERP中最重要的AI的模块，Joule支持越来越多的业务对象的查询，管理，目标是支持 80% 以上的最常用的任务和业务流程。另外客户也可以将Joule作为系统交互的入口，开发属于自己的业务技能和文档信息检索。

Joule 支持多种交互模式，使用户能够以自然语言与系统进行互动：

  • 信息型 (Informational)：Joule 提供简洁的帮助内容摘要，有效回答用户的自然语言问题。例如，您可以询问“什么是无费用销售订单？”或“如何配置采购订单的灵活工作流？”。
  • 导航型 (Navigational)：Joule 推荐相关应用程序，并促进无缝导航，帮助用户执行业务流程。SAP Cloud ERP 中有超过 500 个导航场景，例如“我在哪个应用程序中可以看到采购订单？”。
  • 事务型 (Transactional)：Joule 提供关于业务对象的深入信息，无需打开相应的应用程序。用户可以直接在对话中查看和操作业务对象，SAP Cloud ERP 中有超过 45 个事务场景。例如，您可以直接询问“显示发货方为 Intelli Corp 的销售订单”。它还支持创建洞察卡、检查销售订单状态、续订过期价格和查看情境等功能。
  • 分析型 (Analytical) ：未来，用户将能够提出分析性问题，Joule 将利用 SAP Analytics Cloud 中的 JustAsk 提供分析洞察。

许可： 截止2508中提供的Joule 功能均已包含在基础 AI (Base AI)中，一次开通便可开始免费使用，无需额外购买AI unit。

3： Agents 代理：自动化复杂任务

作为未来发展的重点，代理技术旨在自动化许多曾经需要人工完成的复杂任务。它们不仅仅是能回答问题，更能​​主动规划并执行任务，它们通常是事件驱动和以实现最终任务为目标导向的。

业务示例： 会计应计 (Accounting Accruals) 和国际贸易分类 (Int. Trade Classification)，未来还将包括生产计划员。

目前AI agent还在开发中，您可以关注SAP的产品路线图查看最新的发布时间。

4： Intelligent Insights 智能洞察：提供数据驱动的建议

此构建模块通过生成式AI技术，利用企业的数据资产，提供针对数据的洞察和解析，智能推荐并提供行动建议。

业务示例： 成本中心财务业务洞察 (FBI for Cost Centers) 和集团财务报表财务业务洞察 (FBI for Group Financial Statement)。

许可，智能洞察功能需要购买SAP AI Unit后订阅高级 AI (Premium AI)  功能使用。

5： Document Processing 文档处理：从非结构化数据中提取价值

这个模块专注于从非结构化文档（如 PDF 或 JPG 格式的文件）中提取信息并自动化相关流程。此模块的功能利用SAP BTP中的文档处理服务（SAP Document AI）对于非机构化业务数据进行提取，并进行下一步流程。

核心功能：

  • 销售订单提取 (Sales Order extraction)：能够自动从 PDF 或图像格式的采购订单文件中创建销售订单。这是一个 机器学习基础 AI 场景 (Scope Item 4X9)，无需额外许可证。
  • 质量证书 (Quality certificates)管理：自动化处理传入的质量证书，提取相关信息。通过 SAP Document AI 处理质量证书属于 高级 AI (Premium AI) 功能，需要订购AI unit后开通使用。

6：Intelligent Communication 智能通信：解读交流，自动化流程

旨在从邮件、聊天、电话或文字记录中摘要、分类、提取和验证信息，并自动化相关流程。

业务示例： 争议管理 (Dispute Management)、分类 (Classification)、回归 (Regression) 和聚类/模式识别 (Clustering / pattern recognition)。

7：Machine Learning 机器学习：预测与优化

此构建模块利用企业的数据资产，并对结构化数据应用机器学习算法。

核心功能：

  • 销售绩效预测 (Sales Performance Prediction) 和 预测交付延迟 (Predicted Delivery Delay)。
  • 销售订单自动完成 (Sales Order Auto Completion)：为销售文档中缺失的数据提供建议，加快销售订单和客户退货订单的文档完成。这属于 机器学习基础 AI 场景 (Scope Item 73P)，无需额外许可证。

8：Pro-Active ERP主动式ERP 情境处理：防患于未然

此模块旨在通知业务专家潜在问题，并提出建议和行动，以避免未被发现的业务问题可能造成的严重后果。

核心功能与技术：

  • 情况处理 Situation Handling：自动检测关键业务问题，并通知相关用户。它可以在 SAP Fiori 启动板、电子邮件或 SAP Mobile Start 中提醒用户，并在应用程序中显示情况信息，提供上下文信息以支持知情决策。情境处理已在 SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud 中开箱即用，无需额外操作。它还能利用生成式 AI (GenAI) 提供定制的解决方案建议（测试版功能）。

 

通过这些多样化的 AI 构建模块，SAP S/4HANA Cloud 公有云版不仅提供了强大的智能能力，还在“基础 AI (Base AI)”和“高级 AI (Premium AI)”两种商业化模式下，帮助企业员工更智能、更高效地完成工作，真正实现数字化转型中的“智慧企业”愿景。

entry.title: Understanding Bundles and Scenarios in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Introduction

When starting an implementation in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, one of the first setup steps is defining the scope. Two important concepts in this process are bundles and scenarios. These determine which business processes are available in your system.

What is a Bundle?

A bundle is a predefined collection of business scenarios grouped by a specific business focus.

  • Bundles simplify the scoping process by offering ready-made sets of scenarios.

  • They are country/region-specific, meaning their content may differ depending on the selected country or region.

Available Bundles

  • Baseline Accelerator
    ▪ The essential bundle containing the minimum set of finance-related processes required for a functioning system.

  • Enterprise Management
    ▪ A comprehensive bundle for large enterprises.
    ▪ Includes all content of the Baseline Accelerator plus additional processes such as sales, procurement, and manufacturing.

  • Retail
    ▪ Industry-specific bundle for retail.
    ▪ License-dependent.

  • Public Sector Management
    ▪ Focused on managing budgets, revenue, and expenditure for public institutions.
    ▪ Relevant for government, nonprofit, and educational organizations.
    ▪ Cannot be selected together with other bundles.

Note: The Finance-Led and Professional Services bundles are deprecated and remain available only for customers who had selected them earlier.

Requirement: At least one bundle must be selected in the system scope.

What is a Scenario?

A scenario represents predefined content to support a specific business process.

  • Example: Time Recording (1Q4)

  • Each scenario is identified by a unique three-digit ID, making it easy to locate in the system.

  • Scenarios provide flexibility to tailor the system to the exact processes required by the business.

Group Ledger Scenarios

When defining scope for the first time, a group ledger scenario must be chosen. This choice determines how financial reporting and statements are handled.

Two options are available:

  • Accounting and Financial Close – Group Ledger US GAAP (2VA)

  • Accounting and Financial Close – Group Ledger IFRS (1GA)

Caution: This selection is irreversible. Once finalized, group ledger scenarios cannot be added, removed, or changed later.

License-Dependent and Non-Standard Scenarios

Not all scenarios are included by default:

  • License-dependent scenarios
    ▪ Marked with a lock icon.
    ▪ Require a support case to activate (component: XX-S4C-OPR-SRV).

  • Non-standard scenarios
    ▪ Marked with a warning icon.
    ▪ Trigger a warning message before being added.
    ▪ If confirmed, the change is logged.

Key Points to Remember

  • Bundles = predefined sets of scenarios (mandatory to select at least one).

  • Scenarios = individual business processes (flexible selection).

  • Group ledger scenario = critical one-time decision (US GAAP or IFRS).

  • Some scenarios require additional licenses or approvals.

By understanding bundles and scenarios, you can scope their SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition solution more efficiently and align the system with their business requirements from the start.

Welcome to your one-stop shop to learn and share knowledge about SAP´s ready-to-run public Cloud ERP software solution. SAP S/4HANS Cloud Public Edition is part of SAP Business Suite that brings AI, data and applications together into a fully integrated system. This community is open for anyone in the Cloud ERP ecosystem – customers, partners, and SAP experts.  

Managing a skilled workforce efficiently is paramount for any growing organization. With the release 2508 of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, businesses are empowered with robust HR connectivity options, which streamline workforce management activities. This article provides guidance on handling workforce data, work agreements, and user management using various technical integration options.

In traditional Identity Management (IDM) scenarios, HR systems usually take the lead in managing worker data and work agreements. Business user data might be managed directly in an IDM system or integrated via an HR system. The culmination of these processes sees the provisioning of worker data, work agreements, and business user data into the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition tenant through effective HR and IDM integration. Successful workforce management in this landscape hinges on strategic decisions about data creation through HR or IDM integration, based on which system leads.

 

Results: Realizing Workforce Management Scenarios


Imagine a scenario where SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition is integrated with both the SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central (using SAP Master Data Integration for HR) and an external IDM system via SOAP-based integration with SAP Cloud Identity Services. Here, aligning IDM integration as the leading choice brings forth several advantages.

 

Define Workforce Management System and Choose an Integration Option

  • IDM Integration Leads: Creating business user and worker data first allows users to access the system and perform tasks without needing pre-established work agreements.
  • HR Integration Leads: Worker data and work agreements are provisioned first, followed by business user creation, ensuring structured data flow.

To configure your scenario, access SAP Central Business Configuration for your specific tenant, locate the Define Workforce Management Scenario (106757) activity, and select your desired option: IDM or HR integration. Be sure to confirm data consistency across systems before switching options.

 

Flexible Data Management

With the integration setup, you can create worker and business user data within SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition through the integration with SAP Cloud Identity Services or manually via the Manage Workforce or Maintain Business Users apps. However, once data is created through integration, it cannot be modified directly in these apps. The Entry Source field denotes where data can be edited and its origin. Refer to the Entry Source documentation for further information. If establishing a work agreement through HR integration precedes the creation of a worker record, an error will occur.

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition empowers businesses with flexible HR connectivity options for workforce management. By carefully selecting and implementing integration strategies, organizations can achieve efficient operations and seamless data management, essential for navigating the complex terrain of modern business environments. entry.title: Data Migration for Test Environment Validation in 3-system landscape.
entry.content:
Embarking on the 3-System Landscape (SL) journey in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition can be overwhelming. A newly provisioned test tenant may not operate efficiently unless it contains sufficient known data to support you best with testing and validations. 

To address this challenge and accelerate test tenant readiness, SAP has introduced two strategic options, namely TEST DATA CONVERSION and TEST DATA REFRESH. These features are designed to accelerate tenant readiness by simplify data handling and thereby enhancing overall system efficiency. 

In this blog, we’ll take a high-level look at the 3-SL and explore how TEST DATA CONVERSION and TEST DATA REFRESH facilitate to a smoother, faster, and reliable test environment setup. 

 

3-SL  

As part of your strategic transformation, you are planning to migrate from a 2-SL to a 3-SL in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. This transition is aimed at enhancing system governance, improving testing capabilities, and enabling a clear change management process. Before diving into the data migration services, let’s examine the landscape differences between the current 2-SL setup and the target 3-SL setup to understand the value and impact of this shift.  

 As part of the 3-SL conversion in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, a new test tenant is introduced to support robust validation and quality assurance. However, at the time of conversion, this tenant is provisioned as an empty tenant, with no data (transactional or master data) available. To make this test tenant fully functional and efficient, it must be filled with the essential fuel that drives all meaningful testing, which is nothing but valid data. 

As the saying goes, “Data is the new fuel” and without it, even the most advanced SL cannot deliver value to its fullest. Populating the test tenant with relevant, valid, and consistent data is critical to make the test tenant valuable and ensure a smooth transition to production tenants. 

Now that we understand the importance of data in powering the test tenant, the next step is to determine how to introduce this data effectively into test tenants.

 

Manual Data Uploads: A Time-Consuming Process 

While manual data uploads are technically possible using SAP Fiori apps, templates, or others. but they involve significant drawbacks: 

  • High Effort: Manually preparing valid data and uploading data comes at the cost of extensive time and resources.  
  • Cumbersome Process: This process itself will be complex and challenging as multiple tools and formats need to be used and the complexity increases with large data volumes. 
  • Delayed Availability: Test tenant will not be available for business use until the manual data upload is completed, there by blocking the testing activities for the released objects.

We have seen that, manual data entry is not ideal for large volume of data upload and accelerating tenant readiness. 

 

Embracing Automation: Smarter Ways to Populate Your Test Tenant 

We’re in the era of automation and manual data entry is no longer a viable option for efficient system setup. If you already have rich, validated data in your customizing tenant and production tenant, the question becomes: 
How can you use this data to build a clean, depersonalized, and test-ready environment in your new test tenant. To address this common pain point, SAP has introduced two specialized services designed to simplify and accelerate the process: 

  • TEST DATA CONVERSION – post-conversion accelerator 
  • TEST DATA REFRESH – Ongoing quality assurance 

 

To streamline the setup of a new test tenant, SAP offers two powerful services that cater to different data sources and testing needs: 

 TEST DATA CONVERSION Service – post-conversion accelerator 

  • Purpose: Transfers configuration and application data from the Customizing Tenant to the New Test Tenant. 
  • Goal: Ensures the new test system is available seamlessly and without issues, reflecting the latest customizing setup. 
  • Source System: Customizing Tenant 
  • Target System: New Test Tenant 

This service is ideal for scenarios where you want to validate configurations, execute test cases, test new features based on your previous customizing tenant. 

 

 TEST DATA REFRESH Service – Ongoing quality assurance 

  • Purpose: Transfers selected business data from the Production Tenant to the New Test Tenant. 
  • Goal: Ensures the new test system is populated with production-like test data, enabling realistic testing and ongoing quality assurance. 
  • Source System: Production Tenant 
  • Target System: New Test Tenant 

This service is perfect for regression testing, integration validation, and performance benchmarking using real-world data.

 

What’s Next? 

In this blog, we explored the two key services TEST DATA CONVERSION and TEST DATA REFRESH that help populate a new test tenant efficiently. We also clarified the source and target systems for each service along with their roles in test tenant setup. 

In the next blog, we’ll take a deep dive into the TEST DATA CONVERSION service, examining its capabilities, process flow, and how it ensures a seamless transition from the customizing tenant to the test tenant. Stay tuned to uncover configuration tips, and real-world use cases that make TEST DATA CONVERSION a game-changer for test system readiness.

entry.title: Modifying posting information in the Purchase Order Accruals Process – SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public
entry.content:
1. Purchase Order Accruals Process Overview

The Purchase Order Accruals tool allows you to automatically calculate and add accruals to the General Ledger.
It works by taking data from the Materials Management area and then changing purchase order items into accrual items using the Accrual Engine. This process calculates how much should be accrued for each purchase order item, and you can even test these calculations before applying them. Each period, you can trigger an accrual run that will post all accruals related to various business activities.

This application supports Parallel Accounting, meaning you can calculate and post accruals across different ledger groups at the same time.
From a technical standpoint, the tool is based on the Accrual Engine, where purchase order items become accrual items. While Purchase Order Accruals handles these items, the Accrual Engine deals with the calculation and posting of accruals.

After a purchase order is made, it gets automatically transferred to the Accrual Engine based on how your settings are configured to manage these postings.
In the Accrual Engine, each purchase order is assigned an accrual object.

 

2. The case for posting data change

In the dynamic world of financial accounting, businesses often encounter scenarios where standard functionalities may not align perfectly with specific regulatory or operational requirements.
Purchase Order Accruals play a critical role in maintaining accurate financial records, especially across various ledgers. However, the diverse nature of global accounting practices, such as differing Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP), can necessitate adjustments in how accruals are posted. Businesses might find that certain accrual postings must be customized to comply with local regulations or internal policies. This requires a more flexible approach to modify specific posting data, ensuring precision and adherence to relevant accounting standards.

In the next chapters, we will explore some possibilities in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition when the change of posting data in Purchase Order Accrual postings is required. By understanding these factors, companies can better navigate the potential pitfalls and implement effective solutions that cater to their unique accounting needs.

 

3.  Understanding Accrual Engine Dependencies - Configuration

To begin utilizing the purchase order accrual features, you first need to activate the Purchase Order Accruals application, which involves enabling the appropriate scope item. Depending on your specific needs, you may also need to adjust configuration settings to ensure the functions align with your requirements, like add a review procedure.

There are several configuration options available that allow for personalization of the accrual functionalities. For instance, you can modify settings that determine which purchase order items will have accruals posted, as well as the manner of their posting.

The accrual engine configuration in SAP Public Cloud is company code dependent and not Ledger dependent, meaning you can define different conditions for different company codes. The Accrual Methods available are pre-delivered.

 

4. Exploring the use of BAdi´s to tailor the procedure to different requirements

You add Business Add-Ins (BAdIs) to the functions to fit the procedure to your regulatory or operational requirements.

There are some BAdis available for Accrual processes, namely:

  • BADI_ACE_DOCUMENT_SCHEMA_CLD – Modify Journal Entry Line Items
  • BADI_ACE_ACCHIVING_CHNG_DATE – Change completion date
  • BADI_ACE_ACCHIVING_CHECK – Change result of check
  • BADI_ACE_DOC_FIELDS_MAPPING – ACE document fields mapping
  • FACRA_ADJMT_TOLERANCE_CHECK – Adjustment tolerance check

Particularly relevant for posting modifications is BADI_ACE_DOCUMENT_SCHEMA_CLD, which enables to set below values for journal entry lines:

  •      cost_center (cost center)
  •      profit_center (profit center)
  •      glaccount (G/L account)
  •      item_text (item text of the journal entry item)

 

You can implement custom BAdI logic tailored to your business needs in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition through the Custom Logic App. Find more here.

 

5. Exploring API alternatives to tailor the procedure to different requirements

SAP S/4HANA Cloud provides several APIs for journal entry management that might help in adjusting accrual amounts before posting.

Some key notes on using API for Journal Entry Adjustments:

  • API Journal Entry - Post (Synchronous/Asynchronous): These APIs allow for the posting of journal entries from external systems to your SAP S/4HANA Cloud system.
    Find more here.

 

  • API Journal Entry by Ledger - Post (Asynchronous): This API enables uploading multiple journal entry documents with ledger group information.
    Find more here.

entry.title: How to set up Withholding Tax in Treasury Using Extended Withholding Tax
entry.content:
This blog describes setup of the withholding tax using integration from SAP Treasury and Risk Management (treasury) to the extended withholding tax in Financial Accounting. Besides the calculation and accounting this integration also ensures that corresponding withholding tax information is added to the resulting accounting documents. Such documents are included in standard legal reports in a given country. There are also other possibilities to calculate and account withholding taxes, e.g. using derived flows, however the resulting documents usually lack all the necessary withholding tax information.

Pre-delivered configuration in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud enables posting to supplier. However, this example scenario covers withholding tax on incoming interests in money market instruments posted to customer to describe all configuration steps. 

We focus on the configuration and master data related to withholding tax, we expect that you have already completed general setup for treasury and for the extended withholding tax in Financial Accounting.

 

1          Customizing Prerequisites

The withholding tax code and tax type are defined in Financial Accounting.

If the withholding tax code is defined as Payment Time, the system generates the withholding tax only at the time of payment in the transaction F110 (Automatic Payment). In this case, treasury generates only an empty flow and a corresponding item for table WITH_ITEM with withholding tax base amount.

If the withholding tax code is defined as Invoice Time, the system generates the withholding tax line item in the accounting document of the interest. Treasury then generates a flow with withholding tax amount.

 

2          Customizing in Treasury

2.1       Define Update Type for Withholding Tax

In our example we use update type TAXWH01.

2.2       Define Account Determination for Interest

The extended withholding tax requires posting to supplier/customer, therefore it is necessary to set up account determination for interest in treasury accordingly.

2.2.1     Posting Specification

It contains document type for posting on customer and GL account. The posting key for debit entry is for customer, and the account symbol has posting category for subledger posting in payment currency.

2.2.2     Assign Update Type to Posting Specification

It is important to mark the indication Payment Transaction in the assignment of the update type to posting specification.

2.3       Specify Flow Attributes for Extended Withholding Tax

In this activity we assign the withholding tax update type to the interest update type.

Note. Only maintain key fields that are relevant for the actual interest flow. If you maintain securities account for interest from money market instrument, the configuration won’t be selected in the processing, because money market instrument doesn’t carry securities account.

If you have a scenario with interest for securities do not maintain transaction type, because interests in securities account management (transaction TPM40) don’t carry transaction type.

The assignment also contains the withholding tax type and withholding tax code.

 

3          Business Partner Master Data

The withholding tax data are maintained in the corresponding tab Customer: Withholding Tax        

Note that the withholding tax and withholding tax code must be same as in the activity Specify Flow Attributes for Extended Withholding Tax. Also, the indicator withholding tax agent must be set.

 

4         Processing of the financial transaction

4.1       Create Financial Transaction

Enter the money market transaction as usual. On payment details page, it is crucial that the interest is posted to customer and without payment request:

 

The generated planned withholding tax isn’t visible directly under the Cash Flow tab. You can check it in the transaction TPM13 Treasury Position Flows – Classic

Note that this is only planned withholding tax. In some cases, the withholding tax can depend on some limits related to the business partner, and so the resulting withholding tax at the time of posting can differ. The cash flow in TPM13 serves as a good indication whether everything is set up correctly and the withholding tax is generated.

4.2       Post financial transaction

The withholding tax is posted together with the interest in the transaction TBB1 (Fix, Pay, and Post Flows). There is a limitation in posting log, which puts withholding tax in two-line items, whereas resulting accounting document has only one line item for withholding tax.

For more information about the basic settings for withholding tax, see Withholding Tax in Treasury.

entry.title: Understanding Release Contracts (C0–C3) in S/4HANA Repository Objects
entry.content:
Introduction

This blog is the first in a short series about extension and API stability in S/4HANA. In this post I’ll explain release contracts (also known as stability contracts) — what they are, why SAP uses them, and how they affect the objects you work with every day.

A Release Contract is a classification that indicates how stable a repository object is and how it can be used or extended. It’s SAP’s formal promise that certain objects will remain stable across upgrades. The goal is to strike a balance: on one hand, SAP keeps the system flexible so development can continue; on the other, key technical elements are kept stable so consumers don’t need to rewrite code after every upgrade.

To provide those guarantees, SAP defines different stability/release contracts (C0, C1, C2, …). Each contract describes the intended scope of use — for example, whether something is intended as a safe extension point, a stable in-system API, or a remote API for external callers.

Stability Contracts

       C0 : Contract for Extensions

       C1 : Contract for System Internal Use

       C2 : Contract for Remote API Use

       C3 : Manage Configuration Content

       C4 : Use in ABAP Managed Database Procedure ( Not covered in this blog )

Let us look at how these Contracts apply to comman repository Objects.

CDS Views : CDS views are one of the most common repository objects you’ll come across in S/4HANA. SAP uses release contracts to make clear whether a CDS view can be extended, consumed inside the system, or even exposed to the outside world.

  • C0 - Extend

    • A C0 contract means the CDS view can be safely extended
    • There are two main ways to extend
      • Key user Extensibility : add your own custom fields (or sometimes even make standard fields available) using the Custom Fields app in FIORI.
      • Developer Extensibility : Use ABAP Development Tools (ADT) to create a CDS view extension. This lets you add fields or annotations to the view in a controlled way.
    • The promise here is that the structure of the view won’t change in a way that breaks your code across upgrades.

            

  • C1 - System Internal Use

    • A C1 contract means the CDS view is a stable API for internal consumption.

    • You can safely use a C1 released CDS in :
      • Key user Extensibility : For Analytical Queries, Custom CDS Views
      • Developer Extensibility : In Custom ABAP code in ABAP Cloud or S/4 HANA Cloud.
    • In both cases, the base CDS view provides stable “anchors” where your extensions will survive upgrades.

          

  • C2 - Remote APIs

    • Sometimes the data in a CDS view isn’t just needed internally, but also by external systems.

    • In those cases, SAP exposes the CDS via an OData service (or other service binding).
    • When a CDS view is published for remote consumption, it carries a C2 contract. This ensures the external API is technically stable for side-by-side or third-party integrations.

                

 

Database Tables : Database tables are the lowest-level repository objects in the system. In Practice SAP most often delivers these with C3 ( Manage Configuration Content ).

Tables can also be prepared by the provider for C0 ( Developer Extensibility ) using specific Annotation and release state settings - but this is an opt-in decision design. Most standard tables are not exposed this way , because SAP prefers that extensions happen via CDS views.

The release contract you’ll find for tables is C3 – Manage Configuration Content.

  • C3 - Manage Configuration Content

    • A C3 contract means the table is intended for storing configuration data (for example, customizing or setup values).
    • With C3, SAP promises that the persistence and structure of the table will remain stable so that tools can reliably export, import, or transport configuration across systems.
  • Why Not C0 or C1 for tables ?
    • No C1: Tables are not meant to be consumed directly in ABAP Cloud development. If you need business data, you should always go through a released CDS view
    • C0 possible but rare : SAP does allow tables to be released with C0 if explicitly enabled by the provider (using annotations), but most delivered tables are not. Instead, SAP recommends CDS views or the Custom Fields app for extensibility. 

          

 

Behavior Defination ( RAP Business Object ) : Behavior definitions describe what you can do with a business object in RAP (the RESTful ABAP Programming Model) — things like creating, updating, deleting, running validations, or triggering actions. 

Unlike CDS views, most SAP-delivered behavior definitions are released with C1 (System-Internal Use). A C0 contract for behavior definitions is technically possible (the framework supports it if the provider enables extension anchors), but in practice it is rare. You should always check the API State in ADT to see what’s allowed.

  • C1 - System Internal Use

    • A C1 contract means the business object is safe to consume inside the system, but not open for developer extensions. 
    • You Can :
      • Call the BO’s actions and operations in your own ABAP Cloud code.
      • Bind the BO to a Fiori Elements app and use it in your custom applications.
      • Rely on its structure to remain stable across upgrades.

 

Conclusion

This blog focused on SAP-delivered objects and how SAP marks their stability (C0–C3): CDS views (C0 for extension, C1 for in-system use, C2 for remote APIs), behavior definitions (generally C1 for consumption; C0 only if explicitly enabled), and database tables (commonly C3 for configuration; tables can also be prepared for C0, but that is opt-in).. Although there are other blogs that go deep into specific object types, this post is meant as a pre-read to give you the holistic view. And if you want to actually find released objects and their contracts, the magic lies in the System Library in ADT — and how you configure the tree.

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA for Group Reporting - Introducing New Rules for Automatic Postings
entry.content:
The new rules for automatic postings gradually replace existing functions such as net income calculations and reclassifications. These posting rules offer more capabilities, greater flexibility, and a modern user interface.

The following examples highlight the flexibility of the new rules:

  • Define source data flexibly, including field selections and period interval 
  • Assign multiple document types in one task
  • Include multiple posting lines
  • Define target data flexibly, including field assignment using attributes, and value calculation formula
  • Include results from previous rules
  • Use an enhanced partner filter for intra-unit eliminations.
  • Use the field assignment option 'Value Of ' to post on partner fields

-
Scenarios

With the rules for automatic postings, you can automate tasks such as:

  • Net income calculation for reported data while maintaining the same document type as the source data, and  also the original profit center or segment.
  • Reclassification of the inventory of finished goods to the inventory of semi-finished goods for manufacturing consolidation units.
  • Elimination of the inter-unit sales (reported by the selling consolidation unit) against the cost of sales in the partner unit (the buying consolidation unit).
  • Elimination of inter-unit receivables and payables against a balancing FS item to analyze the intercompany difference.
  • Elimination of intra-unit operations reported between different profit centers within one consolidation unit.

-
Components

Components

  1. When you run a task from the data or consolidation monitor, the system runs all the posting rules included in the rule group assigned to the task.
  2. Each rule selects source data and posts one or more posting lines. The rule automatically assigns the field values and calculates the amounts to post.
  3. The system creates a log that includes source lines, posting lines and any warning or error messages.

Use the following three new apps to manage the posting rules:

 

Rule Definition

Watch this video for guidance on defining a posting rule to calcule the net income:

 

Rule Type

You define a rule with one of the following rule types:

  • Net Income Calculation
  • Postings for Consolidation Units
  • Postings for Consolidation Unit Pairs

The type determines which options are available or required. The rule type also determines the monitor (Data Monitor, Consolidation Monitor) where the rules can be carried out.

Examples: 

  • A posting rule that was defined with rule type Postings for Consolidation Unit Pairs requires the Partner Units filter, and can be assigned to a task only in the Consolidation Monitor.
  • The option Post on Original Document Type is available only for the rule type Net Income Calculation.

Source Data

In this section, you define how the rule selects data. You can use:

  • A Selection defined in the Define Selections app.
  • A Period Selection, such as Year to Date, Prior Period, or Opening Balances.
  • Specific fields to include or exclude when reading data. Excluded fields are aggregated, improving the performance and the readibility of the log. 

Note: The values for Period, Year, Version, Consolidation Unit aren't aggregated.

Example: Only the fields Profit Center and Segment are read in the screenshot below. Details of other fields such as Cost Center aren't retained, and source values are aggregated.

  • You use the "Partner Units" option for elimination rules. In most scenarios you select the option "Partners in the Consolidation Group" . If the source data doesn't include a Partner Unit, you can select "All Partners (including empty)".

Example: Use this option to eliminate business operations between profit centers within a single Consolidation Unit, where there is no partner unit breakdown.

 

Target Data

In this section you define the measures (local currency, transaction currency, group currency, quantity) and document types for the postings. The available document types depend on the rule type. 

By selecting the document type in the rule you can group multiple automatic postings with different document types into a single task. This approach reduces the number of tasks you need to manage.

Example: You can define different rules for inter unit eliminations, such as sales and cost of sales, receivables and payables, or dividends. You can then group these rules into one single task and then post on different document types .

Posting Lines

Each rule must include at least one posting line, and can include multiple ones. To create a balanced posting, you need at least two posting lines. The number of posting lines doesn't determine the number of line items that will be posted. The number of line items depends on the granularity of the source data.

Example: If you define a rule with two posting lines to eliminate the internal sales FS item (posting line 1) against the cost of sales FS item (posting line 2), and your source data is broken down by segment and profit center, it include many lines. The rule will post for two posting lines for each source line.

Overview

In this overview you can create, display, delete, and sort posting lines.

Posting lines define how the source data is adjusted before posting. You can for instance assign a specific FS Item, clear the Material Number, or post to the Partner Unit.

Note: The posting line number is displayed in the log that is created when you run the task. This helps you to easily relate the posting line in the rule definition to the log entry.

Field Assignments

There are different ways to change the field values depending on the field. For FS items, you can assign values using attributes such as role and target attributes.  You can also select or clear a value, or post to the corresponding partner field. If you don't define a specific assignment for a field, the source value is kept.

In the example below the rule swaps the unit and partner fields for consolidation unit and profit center, assigns the functional area YB18 only when it is empty in the source data, and posts the FS item that is the target elimination of the source FS item.

Value Calculation

The value calculation determines the value to post on the measures selected for the target data.

You can use the following:

  • Mathematical operators: + - / * ( ) 
  • Constants: A number
  • Variables: Keyword SOURCE for the source amounts

Rule group

Watch this video to learn how to define a rule group:

 

In a rule group you select the rules to be carried out when you run the automatic postings task.

You can create nodes and subnodes to organize the rule group. For example:

  • Rules for net income calculation and reclassification of inventory of finished goods

 

  • Rules for inter-unit eliminations

 

 

In some scenarios you need to define that one rule "Depends on Previous Rules". This is necessary when the source data for the current rule includes data posted by the previous rule. When you select this option, the system updates the sequence column to show the order of processing.

Assign Rule Group

Once the rule group is defined with all the rules, assign it to the task using the app Assign Rule Groups for Automatic Postings.

You can define this assignment on several criteria:

  • Version: Depending on the configuration of the versions, the assignment can be valid for multiple versions. For example you can define an elimination task that carries out only the profit and loss eliminations for the planning versions, and all eliminations for actuals versions.
  • Time: Valid from Period / Year
  • Consolidation Units: For automatic postings tasks in the data monitor, you can restrict the assignment to selected consolidation units
  • Periods: you can restrict the assignment to certain periods. This allows one task to carry out different rule groups for a monthly (periods 1-11) or for a yearly consolidation (period 12).

Automatic Postings Run and Log

Watch this video to learn how to run a task for automatic postings and display the log:

 

You can change the log layout by selecting fields to display, and by defining grouping and sorting options.

The following fields help you analyze the log:

  • Item Type: Indicates whether the line is a source line or a posting line
  • Rule: The name of the rule that created the automatic posting
  • Posted Line: The number of the posting line defined in the rule
  • Source amounts and Posted amounts

-
